Description.Name: Kraken Good Time
Description.Details: You are on the bridge when Sumire calls out, "Commander, we have an incoming holovid transmission." You motion to Sumire to put the transmission on the viewer, "Greetings, Commander {COMMANDER.LastName}. How are you and {COMPANY.CompanyName} faring? I trust things have been well?" You cross your arms in front of you, "You just keep turning up. Who owes you this time, Front Man?" Front Man smiles and ignores your question, "You have an interesting side gig happening here. Took me a while to work out your angle, but I know what you are doing." You lean back in your chair, "And what pray tell is it you think I am doing?" Front Man pulls out a datapad and scrolls through it, "You, my dear Commander, are deliberately hiring criminals hoping that they have come afoul of the Syndicate and I'll come knocking." Doning your best poker face, you contemplate this revelation before responding, "Now why would I do that? I visibly cringe every time you contact me. Further more, I resent the..." Front Man interrupts your tirade, "Come now, Commander. My records show you have made a few million C-Bills off sending pilots to compete in the games. Your proclivity to hire criminals has been noticed, and not only by the Syndicate." You stare icily at Front Man, "You have the gall to accuse me of impropriety when you are running a 'game' geared at getting the participants killed. You are a hypocrit." Front Man smiles evilly at you, "Ah, see that is where you make a critical mistake. I do not have to play by the same rules as you do. You are a mercenary company, and ultimately answer to the MRBC. Which means you can either risk losing precious reputation with them or reimburse the Syndicate a portion of the funds you've accrued feeding certain crew into the 'game'. Imagine being sanctioned by the MRBC and having your rating plument below 300 should they choose to investigate what happened to poor [[DEAD_MW,{DEAD_MW.Callsign}]]! I suggest you choose wisely, Commander."

Description.Name: Take your chances with any MRBC investigation
Call Front Man's Bluff
Description.Details: You growl at Front Man, "Let me understand this. You feel cheated that we are making more money off of employing criminals than the money they owe you and now you want restitution or you'll report us to the MRBC for inhumane treatment of our crew? Now, that's rich. Tell you what, you do whatever you think is necessary and we'll deal with any possible blowback from the MRBC." Front Man looks at you with displeasure, "You obviously think I'm bluffing, Commander. The Syndicate does not take kindly to being used. I would love to be a fly on the wall when the MRBC contacts you." The image on the holocom winks out. Darius sees your concerned look, "Commander, how bad could it be?"

Description.Name: Extortion
Description.Details: You sit in silence staring long and hard at Front Man, "How much is this going to cost?" Front Man looks away for a few seconds before turning back to you, "Let's see,.. you have really been busy, Commander. All up, I'd say you owe the Syndicate ¢3,959,193. But I do like you, so how about we round that down to ¢3,900,000 and call it a day?" You visibly grimace at the amount, "I want your word that neither you nor your Syndicate will ever bother us again." Front Man looks visibly hurt, "But I like you so much, Commander! You would really end our friendship and insist on us never speaking again, because of this?" "WE... ARE... NOT... FRIENDS!!!" you snarl. "If the price to get you to back off and leave me and my company alone is ¢3,900,000 then I will happily pay it." Front Man turns away from the holoscreen, "As you wish, Commander."
